result.execSummary:
The defendant Adam Mccoy was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: any other sentence the defendant is currently serving

s/BNB/1-5-17
Supplement to Disposition (Restitution)

Court questions the defendant.  Defendant has discussed the matter with Atty Gumz.
  Atty Gumz enters a No Contest plea.  Court questions defendant regarding plea.  Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.   
  Atty Hendee relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty.

Atty Hendee states that parties are waiving the PSI.  
Atty Hendee makes sentencing recommendations.
Atty Gumz agrees and the defense is not requesting a PSI and states arguments.
Defendant makes a statement to the court.

BY THE COURT:  Withhold Sentence; 3 years Probation with conditions; consecutive to any other sentence the defendant is currently serving
Court Costs = $268.00
DNA Sample (if not done so already) + $250.00 Surcharge
Comply with any and all counseling recommended by the Agent
Restitution = $15,770.42 + $1,577.04 surcharge = $17,347.46
Credit to be determined at a later date by stipulation between counsel

  **Court advises defendant that they have been convicted of a Felony and advises rights of voting privileges and of owning a firearm.

Atty Hendee states that the Prelim was not waived.  Atty Gumz agrees and waives the Prelim today and has discussed the waiver with his client.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees with the waiver.  Court accepts the waiver of the Prelim.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings.

Atty Hendee files the information with the Court.  Defendant received a copy of the information and waives its reading.  

Atty Gumz states that the defendant enters a No Contest plea today.

Defendant Adam Mccoy in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Defendant Adam Mccoy in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that this is  a motion to dismiss by the defense.  Atty Hendee states that in speaking with Atty Gumz, the defense will be withdrawing their motion and the parties are resolved.
  Atty Hendee states plea agreement.  Atty Hendee states Restitution + surcharge and provides the supplement to the court.  Atty Gumz agrees.
Atty Gumz withdraws the motion.  Defendant agrees.
